etymology.description: 囗(囗) (wéi, "enclosure") + 禾(禾) (hé, "grain") = depicts a round granary for storing grain
etymology.interpretation: The character combines an enclosure with grain, clearly illustrating a place dedicated to storing grains, like a granary.

examples.chinese: 他们把谷物认真地囷好(他們把穀物認真地囷好)。
examples.pinyin: Tāmen bǎ gǔwù rènzhēn de jùn hǎo.

examples.chinese: 农夫在仓库囷稻米(農夫在倉庫囷稻米)，以备寒冬缺粮(以備寒冬缺糧)。
examples.pinyin: Nóngfū zài cāngkù jùn dào mǐ, yǐ bèi hándōng quē liáng.
examples.english: The farmer stores rice in the warehouse, to prepare for grain shortages in the cold winter.
